customer_addr:
330 RED LANE
BIRD IN HAND, PA 17505

citations.narrative:
There were accumulations of brown debris and feces by the automatic water valves and the PVC drainpipes in 7
enclosures on rack 6 and in 4 enclosures on rack 8. The accumulations around the water valves and PVC drainpipes can
expose the guinea pigs to potential disease risks. Water receptacles such as automatic delivery lines must be cleaned
and sanitized whenever dirty and must be sanitized art least once every 2 weeks. Inadequate cleaning of the automatic
water valves and drainpipes can result in contamination of the guinea pigs in the same enclosure and located in lower
enclosures from those above. Correct by June 8, 2023.

There were accumulations of feces and soiled bedding in 6 enclosures on rack 6. Accumulations of feces and soiled
bedding can exposes the guinea pigs to disease hazards such as bacterial and fungal diseases. This rack of enclosures
was last cleaned more than a week ago. The cleaning process (method and frequency) utilized is not effective in
removing the fecal accumulation inside the enclosures. Primary enclosures must be cleaned often enough to prevent an
accumulation of excreta and soiled bedding and must be sanitized at least every 2 weeks. Correct by ensuring that all
primary enclosures are kept clean and sanitized often enough to prevent accumulations of excreta and soiled bedding.
Correct by June 8, 2023.

Pest Control. Several house flies were present in the guinea pig room. There are no current fly control measures in this
room. Lack of an effective pest control program for flies can result in large increases in the fly population which can affect
the health of the guinea pigs. An effective pest control program must be established and maintained to protect the health
of the guinea pigs. Correct by June 14, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.30 
   
Watering. 
There were accumulations of brown debris and feces by the automatic water valves and the PVC drainpipes in 7 
enclosures on rack 6 and in 4 enclosures on rack 8. The accumulations around the water valves and PVC drainpipes can 
expose the guinea pigs to potential disease risks. Water receptacles such as automatic delivery lines must be cleaned 
and sanitized whenever dirty and must be sanitized art least once every 2 weeks. Inadequate cleaning of the automatic 
water valves and drainpipes can result in contamination of the guinea pigs in the same enclosure and located in lower 
enclosures from those above. Correct by June 8, 2023. 
3.31(a)(1) 
   
Sanitation. 
There were accumulations of feces and soiled bedding in 6 enclosures on rack 6. Accumulations of feces and soiled 
bedding can exposes the guinea pigs to disease hazards such as bacterial and fungal diseases. This rack of enclosures 
was last cleaned more than a week ago. The cleaning process (method and frequency) utilized is not effective in 
removing the fecal accumulation inside the enclosures. Primary enclosures must be cleaned often enough to prevent an 
accumulation of excreta and soiled bedding and must be sanitized at least every 2 weeks. Correct by ensuring that all 
primary enclosures are kept clean and sanitized often enough to prevent accumulations of excreta and soiled bedding. 
Correct by June 8, 2023.

3.31(c) 
   
Sanitation. 
Pest Control. Several house flies were present in the guinea pig room. There are no current fly control measures in this 
room. Lack of an effective pest control program for flies can result in large increases in the fly population which can affect 
the health of the guinea pigs. An effective pest control program must be established and maintained to protect the health 
of the guinea pigs. Correct by June 14, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
